com.snowplow.javaplow

Class TrackerC

  • Object
    • com.snowplow.javaplow.TrackerC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tracker

    public class TrackerC
extends Object
implements Tracker

    TrackerC is the implementing class for the Tracker interface.

    It can be used to track many different types of events. The current version of the tracker is 0.0.2 meaning it is functional but still in beta testing.

    To use:

    • Import the com.snowplow.javaplow package
    • You must first declare a payload and a tracker
    • Tracker will instantiate with a good-for-tracking payload
    • (recommended) Build the payload identity with TrackerC set functions (e.g setUser(String user))
    • (optional) Add custom payload to Tracker with setPayload().
      Payload will configure itself further and prepare for request.
    • Call a specific tracking event. Payload will be automatically configured further
    • Get request is sent to server

    There are two static functions in the TrackerC class: "debug" and "track"

    • To see the output you are sending to the web as it is sending, put `TrackerC.debug = true` in your code.
    • If you would like to test what the output would look like in your usage scenario without
      sending logs to your S3 bucket, put `TrackerC.track = false` in your code.
    • Default values are `TrackerC.debug = false` and `TrackerC.track = true`
    Version:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Kevin Gleason

    • Method Detail

      • track

        public void track()
           throws java.net.URISyntaxException,
                  java.io.IOException
        The basic track command. All other track functions eventually call this. The function compiles all the parameters in the PayloadMap into a proper URI which then is made into a HttpGet instance. The GET request is then sent to the collector URI where it is logged.
        Specified by:
        track in interface Tracker
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException
        java.io.IOException

        Track and ecommerce transaction item. Not usually called alone, but called for each individual item of the ecommerce transaction function.
        Specified by:
        track_ecommerce_transaction_item in interface Tracker
        Parameters:
        order_id - ID of the item.
        sku - SKU value of the item.
        price - Prive of the item.
        quantity - Quantity of the item.
        name - Name of the item.
        category - Category of the item.
        currency - Currency used for the purchase.
        context - Additional JSON context for the tracking call (optional)
        transaction_id - Transaction ID, if left blank new value will be generated.

        org.json.JSONException

      • track_ecommerce_transaction

        public void track_ecommerce_transaction(String order_id,
                               Double total_value,
                               String affiliation,
                               Double tax_value,
                               Double shipping,
                               String city,
                               String state,
                               String country,
                               String currency,
                               List<Map<String,String>> items,
                               String context)
                                 throws org.json.JSONException,
                                        java.io.IOException,
                                        java.net.URISyntaxException
        Track an Ecommerce Transaction Option to provide a Map of only strings of items in the transaction which can be used to track each individual ecommerce transaction item
        Specified by:
        track_ecommerce_transaction in interface Tracker
        Parameters:
        order_id - The transaction ID, will be generated if left null
        total_value - The total value of the transaction.
        affiliation - Affiliations to the transaction (optional)
        tax_value - Tax value of the transaction (optional)
        shipping - Shipping costs of the transaction (optional)
        city - The customers city.
        state - The customers state.
        country - The customers country.
        currency - The currency used for the purchase
        items - A list containing a Map of Strings. Each item must have order ID, sku, price, and quantity.
        context - Additional JSON context for the tracking call (optional)
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.io.IOException
        java.net.URISyntaxException

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        integerContractor - A contractor of type integer.
        stringContractor - A contractory of type String
